result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorian Lamont Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on 9/23/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 9/22/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dorian Lamont Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dorian Lamont Harris in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Dorian Lamont Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 33 DAYS time served.

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by 9/22/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 9/23/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Dorian Lamont Harris not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defendant was unable to be produced due to illness. Defense requests adjournment.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Dorian Lamont Harris not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. MSDF is having techinical difficulties. Court adjourns matter for an in-person plea/sentencing hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Jury Instructions, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Dorian Lamont Harris not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's and its employees
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Dorian Lamont Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Dorian Lamont Harris in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dorian Lamont Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
